meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>stretch</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to grow longer</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be stretched</vocabulary>. You know that this is the version where you aren't doing the stretching, because you're letting someone stretch you on a torture rack in order to win a <reading>beer</reading> (びる). You're that desperate.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the one you learned with the kanji, you lucky duck!
